metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3654 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in openstack-nova's console proxy, noVNC. Bycrafting a malicious URL, noVNC could be made to redirect to any desiredURL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-api - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-api-metadata - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-api-os-compute - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-api-os-volume - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-cells - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-common - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-compute - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-compute-kvm - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-compute-libvirt - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-compute-lxc - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-compute-qemu - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-compute-vmware - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-compute-xen - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-conductor - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-console - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-consoleauth - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-network - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-novncproxy - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-placement-api - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-scheduler - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-serialproxy - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-spiceproxy - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-volume - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
nova-xvpvncproxy - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
python-nova - 2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nova package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:17.0.13-0ubuntu5.3').
